result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant plea not guilty, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Trial Judge - Br 7

8:48 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Bradley R Stayton appeared by video with the courts approval.  Attorney Paisley S Hoffman in court for Bradley R Stayton.  Attorney Tess Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests counts be found transactionally related. No objection. Court so finds. Atty Hoffman stipulates to identification. Witness D.F duly sworn. Direct by State. Venue established. Cross by Atty Hoffman. State moves for bind over, waives argument. Defense objects to bind over, waives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over to branch 7. Victim gives statement.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Brandie S. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

02:23 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.
